name: Farewill
slogan: Changing the way we deal with death
description:
At Farewill, we’re out to change the way the world deals with death, helping people to take control, personally and financially, of what matters to them after they’re gone.

We launched our first product - our will-writing service - in December 2016, and since then we’ve grown to be the largest will-writer in the UK. We launched our second product, Probate, in early 2019, and recently our third, Cremation.

In the last 12 months, we’ve raised over £100M for charity, been on the front page of a national newspaper, averaged 4.9/5 on Trustpilot, grew the team from 15 to over 50, and formed major national partnerships with organisations across the charity, insurance, and mortgage industries.

Based in a beautiful office by the canal in Haggerston (East London), we’re backed by some of Europe’s most exceptional investors - from the founders of Transferwise and Zoopla, to Kindred Capital, SAATCHiNVEST, JamJar and DMGT.

jobs.title: General Manager (Wills)
jobs.description:
What pops into your head when you think of death? Tombstones? Top hats? Grey, drab Victoriana?… It’s probably not a cheery picture.

At Farewill, we’re out to change that. By blending smart technology with outstanding customer service, we’re making everything to do with death easier, faster and fairer for people all over the UK.

This is an enormous market with the opportunity to change the lives of millions of people and their families every year.

As General Manager, you’ll be responsible for our Wills business - the most established, and largest, of our business units. Since launching in December 2016, we've grown to be the largest will-writer in the UK, and won 'National Will Writing Firm of the Year' at the British Wills & Probate Awards. But we're not stopping there.

As the Wills General Manager, you’ll own its strategy, growth, and operations (including full P&L ownership) and be instrumental in taking it from £3m in revenue to £30m (and beyond).

**Why this role?**

We’re looking for somebody exceptional to join our team, and here's why we think this role is a great opportunity for the right person:

1. Make a huge, irreversible impact on the industry: We’re committed to building products and services that transform the industry forever. Right now it’s characterised by exploitative prices and high-street solicitors, and people deserve better. We grew to be the UK’s biggest will writer in 18 months - and we’re not going to stop there, whether through other products that help people plan for death, new geographies, or both.
2. Work with passionate people: We’re a diverse team with shared goals and divergent perspectives - we’re all pulling in the same direction but each bring something different to the table, whether in Ops, Product, Brand or Partnerships.
3. Join at a really exciting time: we want to turbo-charge growth in wills, and we want to do it now. You’ll have the resources and support you need to do that - from building the team to launching marketing campaigns. We’re backed by some of the best investors in the UK (from the founders of Transferwise and Zoopla, to Augmentum, Kindred, JamJar and SAATCHiNVEST), we’re growing at pace, leading our market, and working on a fascinating area of life that often gets overlooked.

###   

### Company Mission

To change the way the world deals with death.

All of us are going to die. It’s a fundamental, tragic, romantic part of what it is to be human - but the industry that sits on top of it isn’t designed to help us make the most of it. We challenge the status quo by building great product experiences that make dealing with death simpler, more personal, fairly-priced & accessible to everyone.

We believe that by equipping people to navigate some of life’s hardest moments, we bring families together, help individuals face up to the fact that they’re going to die, and make life, while it lasts, more meaningful.

**What’ll you do as General Manager (Wills) in your first 12 months**

- Own the strategy and growth of our Wills business (including full P&L ownership)
- Hit our growth plans, whilst keeping margins high
- Work with product, sales, and operations to deliver a truly differentiated customer experience for people dealing with Wills 
- Work with marketing and partnerships to own the UK Wills market - including leaving no stone unturned in terms of how we acquire customers 
- Get stuck into the nitty-gritty of Wills and other adjacent products and services - and really understand what’s involved in helping customers
- Work with our partners including contributing to commercial negotiations and contracts 
- Communicate the vision and goals for the Wills business to the rest of Farewill, our Board, and investors 
- Be part of our Leadership Team and report to our COO, Constance

**Requirements**

Hopefully you'll have some or all of the following:

- You’re a strategic thinker and exceptional problem solver - comfortable with the big-picture, whilst not afraid to get stuck into the details 
- You’re an excellent communicator - you can distill complex problems into intelligible concepts and communicate your ideas clearly 
- You’re analytical, and you track and measure everything. You test ideas and hypotheses and are quick to spot when something isn’t working
- You’re goal-oriented - you’re not afraid of ambitious goals (in fact you prefer it that way) and you rally the people around you to hit them. You celebrate successes and learn (don’t hide) from failures
- You’re able to prioritise and work well under pressure
- Bonus (not requirement): you’ve owned a P&L, managed a large project, or launched a business or product of your own
- Bonus (not requirement): you’ve managed a team, or been part of a Leadership Team before
- Bonus (not requirement): you've seen a company scale to 150+ people 

*If this sounds like what you’d love to be doing, we can’t wait to hear from you. If you love the role but don’t know if you’re a 100% match then still get in touch, we value attitude and propensity to learn above roles in a CV.*

**Benefits**

- Join a fast-growing, creative, multi-disciplinary team of people who love what we do
- The chance to make a meaningful contribution to people's lives and deaths
- Competitive salary and generous stock options
- 28 days of annual leave plus the usual public holidays
- Work from home on Wednesdays, flexible start and end to your day
- Off-site days and team lunches
- Santander cycles membership!
For more info on Farewill have a read [here](https://farewill.workable.com/) or on our [blog](https://farewill.com/blog)

jobs.title: Head of People
jobs.description:
We’re looking for a **Head of People** to join our team of 75 (and growing fast!)

This is an incredible opportunity for an experienced People professional to join the Leadership Team of one of the UK’s most exciting startups. You’ll nurture our unique culture and support our managers at every level to lead their teams - thinking not just about how to help people perform productively, but also about how to keep them engaged and happy at work.  
  
**Who you are:**

You feel confident coaching line managers, providing consistent, fair advice about employee relations, and flexing your approach depending on business needs. You’re a seasoned, knowledgeable expert when it comes to HR policies and procedures, and adept at process and budget management. You’re an experienced manager of Talent functions, with an impressive track record of hiring successfully and at speed. You’re motivated to own the growth of our high-performing, varied team across a wide range of functions and products.  
  
Beyond all this though, you’re up for generating ideas and initiatives that will help the Farewill team thrive. With sound instincts about what individuals and groups need to work together sustainably, your people skills are second to none. You’ve got a natural style, a big heart and a can do attitude. You’re keen to develop top talent, reward and recognise people who go the extra mile, foster collaboration, and drive change. You’re a team-player - passionate about organisational culture and committed to preserving and propelling ours as we gear up to help more people deal with death.   
  
**As our Head of People, over the next 12 months, you’ll:**

- Report to our COO and work with the leadership team to develop our people strategy, supporting a high-performance culture that gets the best out of every team member
- Manage our Talent team, with responsibility for our hiring plan, onboarding and offboarding strategy, and reporting on KPIs
- Support functional heads with their teams’ learning & development including building on our current training programmes and progression frameworks
- Define processes for reviews, performance management and pay negotiations
- Guide managers and employees through performance improvement, sickness absence, disciplinary, grievance and appeal processes, being hands-on where necessary
- Draft internal comms on significant or sensitive topics
- Have input around team rituals, office environment and other culture development
- Advocate for company behaviours and diversity/inclusion, and proactively raise concerns with leadership
- Check team morale via regular surveys and check-ins, as well as by being the go-to person for staff to talk to regarding culture and HR questions

**Requirements**

**Essential:**

- Previous senior HR generalist role, partnering with business leaders
- Managed Talent teams in the past
- Experience in a fast-paced organisation with constant change
- Exceptional communication and relationship-building skills
- Commercially minded and comfortable with using data to inform decision-making
- Team player, but also unafraid to challenge others’ ways of thinking
- Creative thinker and problem solver, who develops innovative ideas and solutions to business problems
- Open to new ideas, knowledge and feedback as well as resilient and calm

Desirable:

- Experience of working in a consumer services organisation
- Experience of opening new office locations
- CIPD qualified

*If this sounds like what you’d love to be doing, we can’t wait to hear from you. If you love the role but don’t know if you’re a 100% match, please still get in touch. We value attitude and propensity to learn above what’s on a CV!*

**Benefits**

**What we offer in return:**

- Competitive salary and generous stock options
- 28 days of annual leave plus the usual public holidays
- Work from home on Wednesdays, flexible start and end to your day
- Regular off-site days and team lunches
- Santander cycles membership!
- A chance to make a meaningful contribution to people's lives and deaths
- And much [more](https://farewill.workable.com/)!

**Please note - In light of the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak, all Farewill employees are working remotely and we will be conducting all interviews virtually for the foreseeable future. We will continue hiring as usual.**

jobs.title: Operations Manager
jobs.description:
We’re looking for an **Operations Manager** to join the growing Operations team at Farewill.

 

This role is a unique opportunity to make your mark on a rapidly scaling business unit, build a team and product from the ground up, and ultimately help change the way the world deals with death.

 

You’ll be owning the Funerals Operations team - which has seen rapid growth since launching in November 2019. In just a few months, we’ve gone from proof-of-concept to one of the largest funeral providers in the country.

 

If you’re interested in joining a dedicated, ambitious, and creative team motivated to make a genuine difference to people in their time of need, then keep reading…

**In the next 12 months you will:**

 
- Take responsibility for our Funeral Operations team, and the metrics which they deliver against
- Structure the team efficiently, enabling them to offer an exceptional end-to-end customer experience
- Manage our team of Funeral Specialists, and support them as the team grows rapidly 
- Own the recruitment and onboarding strategy of the team, to ensure our operational capacity is never limiting our growth
- Work with product and the Head of Funerals to build a world-leading product to support us in managing cases at scale
- Measure, report on and improve metrics such as NPS, hours per case, and employee satisfaction
- Be a key strategic contributor to scaling our Funeral service 
- Report directly into our Head of Sales & Operations, Mitchell

**Requirements**

**Hopefully, you’ll have some or all of the following:**

- Great attention to detail, allowing you to identify problems both at a high-level and case-by-case
- Good analytical skills, comfortable working with data to report on key metrics
- Extensive experience managing and recruiting into a rapidly growing team
- A great understanding of process and how you can set operational teams up for success
- Drive and dedication to make a positive mark on the world, and build a genuinely customer-centric service 

**Extra skills that would be an added bonus (not requirements):**

- Excel / SQL 
- Experience working with product teams
- Funeral industry experience

*If this sounds like what you’d love to be doing, we can’t wait to hear from you. If you’re not sure that you exactly fit the above criteria, get in touch anyway. Personality and attitude is just as important as experience!*

**Benefits**

**What we offer in return:**

- Competitive salary and generous stock options
- 28 days of annual leave plus the usual public holidays
- Work from home on Wednesdays, flexible start and end to your day
- Regular off-site days and team lunches
- Santander cycles membership! 
- A chance to make a meaningful contribution to people's lives and deaths
- And much [more](https://farewill.workable.com/)!

**About Farewill:**  
At Farewill, we’re out to change the way the world deals with death. Helping people to take control, personally and financially, of what matters to them after they’re gone.

 

We launched our first product - our will-writing service - in December 2016, and since then we’ve grown to be the largest will-writer in the UK. We launched our second product, [Probate](https://probate.farewill.com/help/what-is-probate), in early 2019, and recently our third, [Cremation](https://farewill.com/cremation/overview).

 

Our growth to date has been driven by an exceptional product (see our [customer reviews](https://www.trustpilot.com/review/farewill.com)) and key strategic partnerships. We’ve been featured in Forbes, The Times, The Guardian and on [Radio 4](https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b08slvk6) among others. We're also making waves in the charity world - with over £200 million raised for charities on our platform from gifts left in wills.

 

**Our team:**  
We’re a creative, focused team who love what we do. We have backgrounds in design, technology, behavioural psychology, and management consultancy. We love to learn from each other and our customers, and grow together as a team.

Based in our lovely office in Haggerston, we’re backed by some of the best investors in Europe - from the founders of Transferwise and Zoopla, to Kindred Capital, SAATCHiNVEST, JamJar and DMGT.

This is an unusual, fascinating, and emotional area to work in – if you’re up for a big challenge we’d love to meet you.

 

If you’d like to understand our culture and product better, here’s a few articles for you to read: [About Farewill](https://farewill.com/about), [Life at Farewill](https://medium.com/farewill), [Are you worried about your will?](https://www.itv.com/thismorning/hot-topics/are-you-worried-about-your-will)

**Please note - In light of the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak, all Farewill employees are working remotely and we will be conducting all interviews virtually for the foreseeable future. We will continue hiring as usual.**

jobs.title: Probate Solicitor
jobs.description:
We’re looking for a **Probate specialist case handler / probate solicitor** to join our growing legal team at Farewill. 

This role is a unique opportunity to help us shape and grow our probate business.


**In the next 12 months you will:**
Work closely with our probate lead solicitor to help us shape, deliver and grow our probate business.
Help run a mixed caseload of simple and complex applications for grants of representation for non-taxable and taxable cases.
Help build and supervise the team around you in order to deliver on our ambitious goals.
Help drive and improve the quality and consistency of our probate customer experience.
Play an integral role in achieving our mission to change the way the world deals with death.

**Requirements:**
Hopefully, you’ll have some or all of the following:
You have proven experience of probate and estate administration in a volume environment.
You are customer-focused. At Farewill, customers come first. You need to be enthusiastic about our customers.
You have a great eye for detail and the ability to communicate complex legal problems simply.
You enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, being hands-on and getting things done.
You are excited by technology and the opportunity to step away from traditional ways, assumptions and perceived wisdom.

Some extra skills that would be great:
Qualified solicitor, but it’s not essential. Experience is more relevant than qualification for this role.
Experience supervising a team.

If this sounds like what you’d love to be doing, we can’t wait to hear from you. If you’re not sure that you exactly fit the above criteria, get in touch anyway. Personality and attitude is just as important as experience!


**What we offer in return:**
Competitive salary and generous stock options
28 days of annual leave plus the usual public holidays
Flexible start and end to your day
Lovely, spacious, bright office in Haggerston. But, if London’s not for you, that’s ok - we can make remote working work for the right candidate too.
Regular off-site days and team lunches
Santander cycles membership! 
A chance to make a meaningful contribution to people's lives and deaths
And much more!

**About Farewill:**

At Farewill, we’re out to change the way the world deals with death. Helping people to take control, personally and financially, of what matters to them after they’re gone.

We launched our first product - our will-writing service - in December 2016, and since then we’ve grown to be the largest will-writer in the UK. We launched our second product, Probate, in early 2019, and recently our third, Cremation.

* Help to build out our fledgling design system, evolving existing patterns and contributing new ones wherever needed

jobs.title: User Researcher
jobs.description:
We're looking for a **User Researcher** to join our team and help change the way the world deals with death. This is an incredible opportunity to have a real impact on people’s lives, by building products that empower them to navigate some of life’s hardest moments.

 

As well as working day to day in a multi-disciplinary product team, you’ll be joining a fast growing design guild. At the moment we’re two Product Designers, a User researcher, a Copywriter and Marketing Designer.

**As a User Researcher at Farewill over the next 12 months you will:**

- take responsibility for planning and running a range of user research activities to support the design, development and continuous improvement of our products and services
- analyse research data and identify actionable findings which you will communicate both to product teams and wider in Farewill
- involve your team at every stage of research: from asking the right questions through to fieldwork and analysis
- contribute to the culture of the design team and Farewill. For example, make useful contributions in design crits or represent the customers’ perspectives in discussions
- support the wider Farewilll team in making customer-focused decisions by doing things like contributing to the business planning process
- help everyone in Farewill to be better at being part of research by, for example, training people in how to interview customers or conduct usability tests

**Requirements**

**Who you are:**

You’re a user researcher motivated to solve tough problems by deeply understanding users and their needs. You combine deep empathy with rigorous analysis and excellent communication. You have a firm grasp on the fundamentals of research and are looking to expand your experience and work in an environment where you can take on more complex problems.

**We’re looking for someone who:**

- has experience running research in a multi-disciplinary product team
- can take a problem and create a research plan from it
- has excellent interviewing skills, both in facilitation and analysis

- Is keen to develop their skills across a range of methods and get good at working in areas of high uncertainty
- is an excellent communicator
- is self motivated and organised

**Benefits**

**What we offer in return:**

- Competitive salary and generous stock options
- 28 days of annual leave plus the usual public holidays
- Work from home on Wednesdays, flexible start and end to your day
- Off-site days and team lunches

- The chance to make a meaningful contribution to people's lives and deaths
- And much [more](https://farewill.com/careers) 

**About Farewill:**

 

At Farewill, we’re out to change the way the world deals with death. We help people take control - personally and financially - of what matters to them after they’re gone.

We're also making waves in the charity world - with over £220 million raised for charities on our platform from gifts left in wills.

 

**Our team:**

We’re a creative, focused team who love what we do. We have backgrounds in design, technology, behavioural psychology, and management consultancy. We love to learn from each other and our customers, and grow together as a team.
